content: ब्राह्म {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (ह्मी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [ब्रह्मण इदं तेन प्रोक्त वा अण् टिलोपः] {@--1@} Relating to Brahman or the creator, or to the Supreme Spirit; <ls>R. 13. 60</ls>; <ls>Ms. 2. 40</ls>, <ls>Bg. 2. 72.</ls> {@--2@} Brāhmanical, belonging to Brāhmaṇas. {@--3@} Relating to sacred knowledge or study. {@--4@} Prescribed by the Vedas, Vedic. {@--5@} Holy, sacred, divine. {@--6@} Presided over by Brahman as a मुहूर्त (see ब्राह्ममुहूर्त), or a missile. {@--7@} Fit for a divine state or godhead. --ह्मः {@--1@} One of the eight forms of marriage in Hindu law, in which the bride decorated with ornaments is given away to the bridegroom, without requiring any gift or present from him (this is the best of the 8 forms); ब्राह्मो विवाह आहूय दीयते शक्त्यलंकृता <ls>Y. 1. 58</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 21</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 3.">27.</ls> {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of <ls>Nārada.</ls> {@--3@} Quicksilver. {@--4@} The duty or prescribed course of conduct of a king; आवृत्तानां गुरुकुलात् विप्राणां पूजको भवेत् . नृपाणामक्षयो ह्येष ब्राह्मो धर्मो विधीयते ... --ह्मं {@--1@} The part of the hand under the root of the thumb. {@--2@} Holy or sacred study. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a Purāṇa. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of the constellation Rohiṇī.
